IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROMOTE THE EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVES OF CHALLENGER SCHOOL FOUNDATION BY OPERATING SCHOOLS FOR PRESCHOOL THROUGH EIGHTH GRADE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: CHALLENGER'S EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVES ARE CONTAINED IN ITS LONG STANDING MISSION WHICH IS TO DELIVER AN EDUCATION THAT: PREPARES CHILDREN TO BECOME SELF-RELIANT, PRODUCTIVE INDIVIDUALS; TEACHES CHILDREN TO THINK, SPEAK, AND WRITE WITH CLARITY, PRECISION, AND INDEPENDENCE; LEADS CHILDREN TO VALUE THEIR INDIVIDUALITY AND UNALIENABLE RIGHTS; AND INSPIRES CHILDREN TO EMBRACE CHALLENGE AND FIND JOY AND SELF-WORTH THROUGH ACHIEVEMENT.
IRS990.Desc: DURING THE 2022-2023 SCHOOL YEAR, CHALLENGER EDUCATED APPROXIMATELY 3,659 STUDENTS IN ITS 3 AND 4 YEAR OLD PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS. CHILDREN GRADUATING FROM CHALLENGER'S PRESCHOOL PROGRAMS ARE PREPARED TO ENTER KINDERGARTEN WITH A HEAD START THAT PLACES THEM ONE OR TWO YEARS AHEAD OF THEIR PEERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DURING THE 2022-2023 SCHOOL YEAR, CHALLENGER EDUCATED APPROXIMATELY 5,323 STUDENTS IN ITS KINDERGARTEN AND ELEMENTARY SCHOOL PROGRAMS. ON THE MOST RECENT IOWA ASSESSMENTS, CHALLENGER'S AVERAGE KINDERGARTENER OUTSCORED 98 OF 100 TEST TAKERS AT HIS/HER GRADE LEVEL, WITH SIMILAR RESULTS FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 1 THROUGH 5.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: DURING THE 2022-2023 SCHOOL YEAR, CHALLENGER EDUCATED APPROXIMATELY 959 STUDENTS IN ITS MIDDLE SCHOOL GRADES. ON THE MOST RECENT IOWA ASSESSMENTS, CHALLENGER'S AVERAGE EIGHTH GRADER OUTSCORED 99 OF 100 TEST TAKERS AT HIS/HER GRADE LEVEL, WITH SIMILAR RESULTS FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 6 AND 7.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: CHALLENGER IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING ITS STUDENTS WITH A SUPERIOR EDUCATION. THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY HAS 27 SCHOOLS THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA, UTAH, IDAHO, NEVADA, AND TEXAS. EACH LOCATION PROVIDES AN EXCELLENT LEARNING ENVIRONMENT WHICH INCLUDES DAILY MEALS AND SNACKS. MANY CHALLENGER LOCATIONS OFFER AN ENRICHMENT PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS WHO NEED TO STAY BEFORE OR AFTER REGULAR SCHOOL HOURS. THIS PROGRAM OFFERS VARIOUS EXTRACURRICULAR CLASSES SUCH AS SOCCER AND OTHER OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES, MUSIC, DANCE, SPECIALIZED ART, CHESS, ROBOTICS, AND FOREIGN LANGUAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XI, LINE 4B
SCHEDULE D, PAGE 4, PART XII, LINE 4B

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THROUGHOUT THE TAXABLE YEAR, CHALLENGER SCHOOL HAS MET THE REQUIREMENT FOR PUBLICIZING ITS RACIAL NONDISCRIMINATION POLICY BY POSTING AN APPROPRIATE NOTICE ON ITS WEBSITE HOMEPAGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIPS ARE AWARDED FOR USE AT THE SCHOOL FOR THE NEXT SCHOOL YEAR. NO ADDITIONAL MONITORING IS REQUIRED FOR THOSE SCHOLARSHIPS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 7

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARWEAR: CHALLENGER PURCHASES ITS STAFF UNIFORMS AND PRESCHOOL NAP BAGS FROM SCHOLARWEAR, A PRIVATE FOR-PROFIT UNIFORM SUPPLIER OWNED IN PART BY MARCELLE JACOBSEN, WHO IS THE SISTER OF DIRECTORS RYAN BAKER AND KAYLEEN WILSON. TO ENSURE THAT ALL UNIFORM AND PRESCHOOL NAP BAG PURCHASES ARE ARMS LENGTH AND FOR NO MORE THAN FAIR MARKET VALUE, CHALLENGER HAS APPOINTED A UNIFORM COMMITTEE. THE COMMITTEE EVAULATES UNIFORM NEEDS, PERFORMS AN ANNUAL COMPETITIVE MARKET ANALYSIS, AND MAKES RECOMMENDATIONS TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS OPERATES PURSUANT TO A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT REQUIRES THE DIRECTORS WITH A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WITH RESPECT TO SCHOLARWEAR (RYAN BAKER AND KAYLEEN WILSON) TO ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON RELATED MATTERS. ALTHOUGH SCHOLARWEAR ALSO SELLS UNIFORMS DIRECTLY TO CHALLENGER STUDENTS, CHALLENGER IS NOT INVOLVED IN SUCH TRANSACTIONS. SOLTIS INVESTMENT ADVISORS: SOLTIS HAS BEEN A 401K CO-FIDUCIARY AND INVESTMENT ADVISOR FOR CHALLENGER FOR OVER TEN YEARS. HAL ANDERSON IS A CO-FOUNDER OF SOLTIS, ITS CURRENT CHAIRMAN, AND FORMER PRESIDENT, CEO AND EVP. CHALLENGER'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS (WITH HAL ABSTAINING) CONSIDERED AND CONCLUDED THERE WAS NO CONFLICT OF INTEREST BECAUSE: (1) IT IS IN CHALLENGER'S BEST INTEREST TO HAVE A 401K CO-FIDUCIARY AND INVESTMENT ADVISORY IN VIEW OF THE COMPLEXITIES AND RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH INVESTING IN GENERAL AND ERISA COMPLIANCE IN PARTICULAR; (2) THE FEES PAID TO SOLTIS ARE CONSISTENT WITH THE INDUSTRY, AS DEMONSTRATED BY REGULAR BENCHMARKING; (3) HAL HAS DECLINED TO RECEIVE ANY COMPENSATION FOR HIS ROLE AS A DIRECTOR; (4) THIS RELATIONSHIP WAS ESTABLISHED OVER A DECADE BEFORE HAL BECOMING AN INSIDER; (5) THE RELATIONSHIP WILL BE DISCLOSED IN ALL IRS 990 AND OTHER FILINGS; AND (6) HAL WILL SIGN A COI POLICY ACKNOWLEDGMENT LIKE ALL DIRECTORS.

CHALLENGER'S EDUCATIONAL OBJECTIVES ARE CONTAINED IN ITS LONG STANDING MISSION WHICH IS TO DELIVER AN EDUCATION THAT: PREPARES CHILDREN TO BECOME SELF-RELIANT, PRODUCTIVE INDIVIDUALS; TEACHES CHILDREN TO THINK, SPEAK, AND WRITE WITH CLARITY, PRECISION, AND INDEPENDENCE; LEADS CHILDREN TO VALUE THEIR INDIVIDUALITY AND UNALIENABLE RIGHTS; AND INSPIRES CHILDREN TO EMBRACE CHALLENGE AND FIND JOY AND SELF-WORTH THROUGH ACHIEVEMENT.

CHALLENGER IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING ITS STUDENTS WITH A SUPERIOR EDUCATION. THE ORGANIZATION CURRENTLY HAS 27 SCHOOLS THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA, UTAH, IDAHO, NEVADA, AND TEXAS. EACH LOCATION PROVIDES AN EXCELLENT LEARNING ENVIRONMENT WHICH INCLUDES DAILY MEALS AND SNACKS. MANY CHALLENGER LOCATIONS OFFER AN ENRICHMENT PROGRAM FOR STUDENTS WHO NEED TO STAY BEFORE OR AFTER REGULAR SCHOOL HOURS. THIS PROGRAM OFFERS VARIOUS EXTRACURRICULAR CLASSES SUCH AS SOCCER AND OTHER OUTDOOR ACTIVITIES, MUSIC, DANCE, SPECIALIZED ART, CHESS, ROBOTICS, AND FOREIGN LANGUAGE.
RYAN BAKER KAYLEEN WILSON DIRECTOR DIRECTOR SIBLINGS DEREK BAKER RYAN BAKER & KAYLEEN WILSON SYS ANALYST DIRECTORS SIBLINGS
THE COMPLETED FORM 990 WAS CIRCULATED FOR REVIEW AND COMMENT BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

THE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY IS CIRCULATED TO AND DISCUSSED AMONG THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. EACH DIRECTOR SIGNS AN ANNUAL ACKNOWLEDGEMENT STATEMENT CONFIRMING THAT HE/SHE HAS RECEIVED, REVIEWED, UNDERSTOOD, AND COMMITTED TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY.

COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO IS SUBJECT TO COMPENSATION AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST REQUIREMENTS AND PROCEDURES ESTABLISHED IN CHALLENGER'S BYLAWS. COMPENSATION MUST BE APPROVED BY OFFICERS AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER CONSIDERING: PERFORMANCE AND PRODUCTIVITY; PREVAILING RATES FOR THE COMPARABLE POSITION IN COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS; PREVAILING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS; TOTAL COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS; AND THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT.

COMPENSATION OF OFFICERS, DIRECTORS, AND KEY EMPLOYEES IS SUBJECT TO SPECIFIC COMPENSATION AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST REQUIREMENTS AND PROCEDURES ESTABLISHED IN CHALLENGER'S BYLAWS. UNDER THE BYLAWS, OVERALL EMPLOYEE COMPENSATION MUST BE APPROVED BY OFFICERS AND THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AFTER CONSIDERING: RECOMMENDATIONS OF MANAGERS AND SUPERVISORS; EMPLOYEE POSITION, QUALIFICATION, PERFORMANCE, AND PRODUCTIVITY; PREVAILING RATES FOR COMPARABLE POSITIONS IN COMPARABLE ORGANIZATIONS; PREVAILING ECONOMIC CONDITIONS; TOTAL COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS; AND THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT.

CHALLENGER SCHOOL FOUNDATION'S ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS (INCLUDING ARTICLES OF ORGANIZATION, BYLAWS, CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS) ARE AVAILABLE FOR INSPECTION AT CHALLENGER'S CORPORATE OFFICES UPON REQUEST. LIKEWISE, COPIES OF THE ORGANIZATIONAL DOCUMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
SCHOLARSHIPS REPORTED IN REVENUES -723,599 SCHOLARSHIPS REPORTED IN REVENUES 723,599
